instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the analysis of the pest on broad bean leaves?
Output: The visible spectrum and near infrared reflectance spectra were used in the analysis of the pest on broad bean leaves.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the analysis of the pest broad bean leaves?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used to analyze the spectra and identify the optimum waveband for pest detection was by combining the derivative spectra.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification models of artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM) in the analysis of the pest on broad bean leaves and how far it can go?
Output: The metric used in the analysis of the pest on broad bean leaves was classification accuracy. The best classification accuracy was used to evaluate the classification models of artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM),which can 95.05% and 90.10%.

instruction: How did the researchers compare the performance of the artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM) classification models for pest spectrum classification on the cloud computing platform?
Output: The researchers compared the performance of the artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM) classification models for pest spectrum classification on the cloud computing platform by analyzing the accuracy and operating efficiency of both models. They found that the ANN pest spectrum classification model had higher accuracy than the SVM pest spectrum classification model. Additionally, they observed that the ANN model had higher operating efficiency on the cloud platform.

instruction: Can spectroscopic methods be considered superior to traditional methods for the spectral recognition of crop biotic stress, based on the analysis of broad bean leaves with different levels of pests and the comparison of artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM) classification models on a cloud computing platform?
Output: Yes. Based on the analysis of broad bean leaves with different levels of pests and the comparison of artificial neural network (ANN) and support vector machine (SVM) classification models on a cloud computing platform, spectroscopic methods can be considered superior to traditional methods for the spectral recognition of crop biotic stress. The experiment results showed that the ANN pest spectrum classification model had higher accuracy than the SVM pest spectrum classification model. Additionally, the ANN model also had higher operating efficiency on the cloud platform. This suggests that spectroscopic methods, combined with cloud computing technology, can provide a new technique and method for the spectral recognition of crop biotic stress.
